newsitem.title: ZAMBIA: ZCCM to retrench thousands of employees.
newsitem.headline: ZCCM to retrench thousands of employees.

text.p: Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines Ltd (ZCCM) would retrench between 10,000 and 15,000 workers as part of its privatisation, Finance Minister Ronald Penza said on Wednesday.

The government has put ZCCM, the largest public enterprise in Zambia, up for sale as part of its privatisation drive and Penza said the government wanted to move faster on ZCCM's privatisation next year.
"My government in 1997 will be moving more strongly on privatisation of ZCCM. That is very, very important," Penza told Reuters in an interview.
He said the government wanted to settle the retrenchment of 10,000 to 15,000 ZCCM employees before the sale of the company.
"I think 10,000-15,000 employees can be affected," he said
"We need to address firstly and upfront the issue of retrenchment. That is one aspect of the programme that could delay the privatisation programme," Penza added.
The Zambia Privatisation Agency said last week that 39 companies had pre-qualified for buying the copper mining and power assets of ZCCM.
Penza said the government had set a two year time-limit to finalise the sale of ZCCM.
"By the time we come to when the company is being taken over, we must minimise the issue of industrial unrest and we can only do that by funding retrenchment upfront," Penza said.
